UZAaR_pB-g5EM-T0-Z5fJw.text: Had the shoyu ramen with mild level spicy. Wow. Broth was flavorful and even though it was mild spicy, it had a good spicy taste. Place is small and quite busy. Had order kimchi fried rice to try later when I get home!

photos.caption: Photo of Ramen Kobo - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shoyu Ramen

SpRndNvmTx6Qv12C8IzLOQ.text: Located in Henderson, Ramen Kobo, a popular Ramen shop. offers the lovable flavors Shoyu, Tonkotsu, Tonkotsu-Shoyu, and Miso Broth.  They also have the option for a Veggie Ramen.  Instead of a normal Chashu (Pork) you receive Beansprouts, Spinach, and etc in your Ramen.  I ordered Tonkotsu Ramen and added my usual Nitamago (2 egg/which is just an egg cut in half) and Nori (Seaweed).  The first time I went, the Noodles was nice and soft, the broth goes nicely with the noodles; but, it was thick almost like watery gravy. The second time I went, which is most recent; the broth was a nice flavor and wasn't thick, but just right.   The first time I went, they had ground meat as one of the toppings on my Ramen.  The second time I went, they had the usual piece of meat like other Ramen shops. Also at Ramen Kobo, you can choose the level of spiciness for your ramen.  The room was quite small, so if you go in a large group it might take a while to be seated, but it was a fun experience.  There's a window near the entrance where you can watch them make the noodles, they call it the Noodle Factory.  The staff was really nice and helpful when I went.  It had a nice atmosphere to visit with friends and family.

n8rhPYuRUF5HqssuaWiNeQ.text: They have terrible service. I came in and had a Starbucks, and my server told me I can't drink it but it was okay to leave it on table (which was fine). Then I have another women come over and tell me I can't have it and grabbed at it, and said she'll put it in the refrigerator. I told her I know the other women told me I couldn't but it was ok to leave on the table. So she said she was wrong and kept going back and fourth, and then the other server came over and said I can't have it because the manager said and the rule just changed. I went to put it in my car and they all continued to stare, I heard them in the kitchen speaking about it. After the rude and awkward stares I left, and as I was leaving they were still talking about my drink in the kitchen. Mind you, I ordered a Diet Coke. I come pretty often, 3 times this last month actually. I'm extremely disappointed in the customer service and how they treated me over a Starbucks drink. They'd rather lose my continuous service over a $3 drink.

iB-C-UEZ7zrLGFwV6R4Vmw.text: The food was amazing and I'll definitely be coming back because of it, but my biggest turn off was the service.   The service was amazing when we got there. Seated right away, they got us drinks super quick, we even got our orders all within 15 minutes of being in the restaurant. It's what happened AFTER we got our food that bothers me. We were completely ignored. And by completely, I mean we weren't even acknowledged by several workers for almost 30 minutes. We tried several times to get the attention of numerous people to get the check to leave and it took multiple tries for anyone to even notice we were trying.

bpt-b6c_tSR29yhyjoqNEA.text: This is by far one of my favorite ramen places in Vegas! Everything is so tasty and affordable as well!!!!! My favorite one here is the miso ramen with the egg & hot literally can eat that everyday!

Fayl_iygpBNCSiwWmzue_A.text: Great home made noodles, especially on cold Vegas nights. Only things I can really complain about is the space. It's a very small restaurant with limited seating, which causes waiting times to increase. That tells you even though it is small, it's high quality noodles. So if you are not in a hurry, check it out.  The staff is friendly, noodles are made fresh. Only things you need to worry about is picking what broth you want and what spice level suits you. I'm a fan of spicy, but I haven't gone past mild at this spot, maybe one day.

NMg0WyWpHsBHzsW8UKkvpA.text: I really wanted to try this place. The reviews made it sound amazing. I ordered a Chicken Ramen, with egg (I love egg), seaweed, corn and their regular toppings. Everything was cooked well, it just needed more flavor. I felt like i was drinking water. Ive had good ramen and bad ramen, this was just okay.

QQmdcH9NdG3L1eoFJZtyXw.text: I'm a sucker for fresh noodles and I was told that they make their own here. I also LOVE my ramen spicy so I was eager to try this place out once I heard about it. The inside is really small but I love the simplicity of the design. It was pretty busy when I came here but the wait was surprisingly short.  I ordered the medium spicy miso ramen (should have gotten hot/fire). I didn't add any other toppings because I thought they were on the pricey side. Most of them are $1+. I thought the broth and the stuff it came with is comparable to the spicy ramen from Ramen Sora (ground meat, bamboo, etc). The broth is super thick and heavy, but delicious.  The staff was really friendly but once they brought out our check, I felt really rushed. The lady was about to take my bowl away before I even answered her question as to whether I was finished or not. I get that it's a small place and people are waiting but I'm a slow eater and don't like to be rushed.

gVka2JztZHGT4ynXyO6fMw.text: Ichi Ramen is way better. Save your money and go to Ichi, KoBo is garbage. What place closes at 2:30 in the afternoon, and is out of Sopporo beer!?? More like waking into a jack in the box at 2am.

_DszORWu5CXhTOHDpdN__Q.text: Location is always busy, and it is  small inside but they definitely deliver on food.  They have an enclosed glass area where you can see noodles being made.  This day I came in and ordered a large  pork belly bowl ( 5.75 plus tax) to go as my time was limited. This bowl was very filling although at first sight I thought it was small but I was wrong. KOGf2NHs5tvnRmlhhCqeMQ.text: Usually come here when I have ramen cravings that I need satisfied. I've had the Vegetable Ramen many times as well as the Chicken Ramen. I normally get hot sauce on the side so I can make it as spicy as I choose. The place is small but always packed. Consistent.

tUOD_OVDx0wj9Al2wYo6Kw.text: First, I'll share that I've never been to a ramen restaurant before. I'm forever eating Vietnamese, Japanese, and Thai food, but I've never been to a ramen specific restaurant until today.  Since I'm currently doing this whole plant-based lifestyle, I opted for the vegetarian bowl with vegetable broth and added black mushroom ($1) and mustard greens ($1.50). Seems a little excessive to charge $1.50 for 8 leaves of greens, but whatever, it was my choice.  My bowl came out and the first thing I noticed is that it was very oily broth. Again, I've never been to a ramen place so I have no idea if that's normal or not...but I wasn't stoked about it. The dish was delicious, I ordered level 3/4 for spiciness and that was perfect for me. The noodles were excellent, the flavors were fantastic, but I wish it had been less oily. I went from feeling healthy about my choice to feeling like I need to do some extra cardio this afternoon.   One other note - the vegetable bowl was the only option for vegetarians/vegans. All the rice dishes have meat and/or egg in them. This isn't a huge deal because the main dishes are the ramen, but just a heads up if you are a plant-based eater.

X1eu2NAIiO_I9z7G1VBSqA.text: This is my favorite ramen place. I don't normally leave yelp reviews but I felt compelled to solely because I love this place so much.  I usually get the shoyu ramen. Delicious. Broth is so good and the service is great too.

9IyIhSsyuDLhc68IfRvqjA.text: I have been there a handful of times and it's pretty good. The staff is always friendly and very quick with bringing out your order. This is located in the same plaza as the EOS Fitness on Durango.   I usually get the chicken ramen and that never fails to satisfy. It's always really packed at lunch so try to avoid rush hours. Also, if you do come solo or with one other, the bar is always a great option to dine at.   My kids always get the fried rice! They can eat that rice for days! Other than the basic ramen and fried rice, I haven't explored the menu too much because I'm usually here for a post workout meal or a quick bite before work. Plus, I can't lie I do have a few other top ramen spots in I prefer. For being in the southwest part of town, it definitely does the job!

80KN0vCEai8QOK2kZdQ2Ag.text: Great soup ! Nice friendly staff! Tasty Ramen noodles!

GcwXmBgWWZfsmoFtFzIBiA.text: My fav local ramen spot! Jinya (probably the most popular ramen spot in LV) is honestly overrated, but it is better for group outings. Whereas KoBo has great authentic Japanese decor, but is unfortunately a very small restaurant.   I personally enjoy ordering takeout, as it's just as good when you enjoy it in the comfort of your own home, but without the wait and cramped feelings.   I love how you can adjust the heat to your preference, 'Hot' has my heart.   PS don't forget to add an egg!

42-tjwfX65ogL4M04pewtw.text: VISUAL AESTHETIC: 4/5 Location can be crucial for restaurants and in this case, Ramen KoBo is tucked away. Fortunately, It is well seen but the road to enter the shopping center it is located in, is in all honesty, awful due to the proximity being so close to the freeway; cars are running fast and the roads are large and difficult to cross.  The interior is very modern with wooden paneling and matching tables and chairs. The lights are chain hung and include a line of studio bulbs which keep the venue well lit but with a warm tone. The bar area can seat quite a few patrons and is spacious despite the small size of the restaurant itself. It's very pleasing to the eye, with the black framing very clean. The decor is classic to that of most Japanese restaurants, with banners hung above the bar area.   FOOD: 4.8/5 The noodles here are fresh made, with a large glass window to see the process. There is a machine that essentially flattens the dough and slices it up into portions. Because of this, the noodles are chewy and have a great buoyant texture.   The way the menu is situated makes it very easy to read and pick the type of broth you would like, how spicy, and any extra toppings that you would want with your ramen which includes adding a portion of noodles.   I ordered the shoyu (chicken broth) which tends to be hotter. In the case of soup, it keeps the ramen at a nice temperature without cooking through the vegetables. The ramen comes with bamboo shoots, chaysu pork, ground meat, chili slices, and other typical vegetable ingredients. They were all fresh and still contained a light crunch which was pleasant. I also added a soft boiled egg. The extra toppings can cost anywhere from .50 to 2.50.   I also ordered the chaise fried rice. Ramen KoBo generally has some of the best made chaysu I have come across in Las Vegas, very tender and not try at all. The marinade is delicious but not overpowering that it would ruin the quality taste of meat. The fried rice's presentation was a bit scattered, but tasted good with the chopped ingredients still intact enough to have a variety of texture with the rice.  SERVICE: 5/5 The service was excellent, with the waiters and waitresses attentive to our table. I overheard the servers actually helping out certain individuals when menu items were questioned as well. Overall, everyone was friendly, well adjusted to their surroundings in the case that the restaurant is small and can be hard to maneuver around in, and attentive to the customers.  OVERALL EXPERIENCE: 4.9/5 Honestly, I have been to this location before and was disappointed in how salty the broth was. However today the taste was perfect, not too salty or bland and I was very pleased with the overall taste, service, and of course, the cute Halloween decorations. Ramen restaurants have become abundant in Las Vegas, and with that, competitive advantage is important. This location is supposed to be a sister of Monta, and I was not fond of that location's ramen. However, KoBo has impressed me with today's service. I will definitely be back soon.

WzwmxNnu9_cWaTCpMPPwgw.text: Good experience here overall.   Very small restaurant and you get hit by cold air every time the door opens.   The menu is very much "Build-your-own"  You can choose the broth, spice level and and extra ingredients.   I felt it was slightly expensive as I added a soft boiled egg and extra pork and my total was over $13. My gf did the same and added shaved green onion so hers came out over $14.   I ordered the pork broth, chashu pork and egg and medium spice and it was very good. They handmake their own noodles which you can see through a window as you walk through the entrance.   Only reason it doesn't get 4 stars is the price. I could get close to the same thing for $5 cheaper.

B_OJsRnzrokqgrTkJUeI5A.text: I felt so gross after eating here! I couldn't even finish my bowl. I had the Shoyu Ramen and the little chunks of fat in the broth completely changed my mood of the meal. I really like two other Monta locations a lot, I prefer them over every other ramen place in the city. This place was just dissapointing. They only have fried rice as side dishes and use one type of noodle verses thin/thick.    It's more expensive than other two Monta locations (sister stores) as well!!! There are better options than this place!

R8kiHw4TzJ5S3JU5cOeVMA.text: This place is super cute, really small industrial feel has a wooden bar and they have vegetarian options! It's perfect for date night if you like ramen

YW_-EGPsjdc3xFFRgxvFtQ.text: I love ramen kobo!  Their broth is light n fresh, no added MSG (just what's on the soy sauce)!  Their noodles are fresh, made in front of the restaurant.  They cook with quality ingredients which is a big plus for me.  The place is small and their always busy, but it's worth the wait!

PZBGfi6KXFT8R5ka9AmJ8Q.text: Ramen is average at best. One thing that they could easily do better is give hot broth instead of like warm. Only go here because it's close

W1qFPv0H1t7aw9wsJ3WyvQ.text: I love trying new ramen places and this one hit the spot. Despite craving ramen in the Vegas summer heat, this one here has a simple make your own ramen menu along with ready to order dishes. The flavors are more to my liking than I would say maybe Monta and Jinya combined. It's definitely a running up to Ramen Sora but it might just win for me since the miso with mild flavoring opened up the taste buds really well. You could add more if you want but it was the amount of flavors I needed. On the side I had chasu pork buns I believe which needed more flavor and chasu but the main idea of this review is definitely the ramen. I love the environment, it has the feel of what a ramen should should be and you can watch them make handmade noodles so you know the quality of the noodles are always fresh. It is a little far for me since I'm centered in the spring mountain area but the drive is worth it if you want a good ramen fix.

fNXOwjdagk_D1riGA559RQ.text: Fast review here.  Small place. Perfect ramen and service.  Get at least the medium heat. Chashu is spectacular. Kim chee excellent. Nothing to complain about here...

E2yKRyk2NR9agDaLG-STpA.text: Pretty good, I ordered to-go the miso ramen with extra chasau and the kimchi fried rice. I didn't get any spice because I wanted to compare to Ohjah down the street.  I don't know if its because it was a to-go ordered but all the noodles stuck together when I placed them with everything in the bowl. I had to break them into short noodles since they didn't unwind. Also since it was my first time I was expecting the egg in the ramen, should of read the menu closer. Overall good flavor but I just prefer Ohjah a few doors down if I'm going to pick up food on this side of town. If you are dining there, this is place is super small like Monta before they remodeled.
